analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern the establishment, modification, or abolishment of committees, councils, or offices within the Executive Branch of the U.S. government. These entities are often created to address specific issues, coordinate efforts across different agencies, or provide advice to the President. The documents also delegate authority to specific individuals or agencies, outline their responsibilities, and define their relationships with other parts of the government.
title: Executive Branch Entities: Formation, Modification, and Coordination
